name: places/ChIJudzyKc1bwokRlgir6HVuq_4
formattedAddress: 250 South St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 250 South St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text: They BROKE my new sunglasses. I parked, went to an appointment, came back, paid, then got in my car. When I went to put on my sunglasses, one of the legs was broken and fell off completely shortly after. I talked to the garage attendant and asked what had happened. He said it wasn't his fault and I had no PROOF that he broke them, even though there were cameras. I contacted Icon corporate, and after a long back and forth, they said it was my fault, and that I should have taken ALL items of value when I left. According to them, it was my own "lack of responsibility" that lead to this problem. In other words, anything in your car when you park with Icon could be damaged, broken, or even stolen, and they'd blame you for it.

originalText.text:
Very friendly staff but inefficient and too many elevator issues, calling hours in advance can still lead to waiting up to several hours for your car to arrive. It is a very high monthly cost for the coin-toss of having access to your vehicle when you need it.

Update: Been parking here for a few years now, another gripe I have associated with the high monthly cost is that they have damaged my car twice now. While they own up to it and admit fault both times, getting reimbursed for the cost of repairs can take over a month

If you don't live nearby, I recommend parking somewhere else.

originalText.text: The best garage in NYC. The manager Luis is extremely responsive and attentive. Shows me the best customer service with my Lamborghini Huracan. This review is not fake you can DM me on IG @iamethanduran

text.text: The best garage in NYC. The manager Luis is extremely responsive and attentive. Shows me the best customer service with my Lamborghini Huracan. This review is not fake you can DM me on IG @iamethanduran

originalText.text:
These people display no regard for other people's property and time. Multiple times I had to wait over 15 minutes to get my car and that was with prior notification. Worst of all, my brand new car was damaged, which I don't understand how that's possible, the entire space is huge. They claim that it doesn't happen often but I've seen it personally how these valets park customers vehicles, back it into a wall, scrape the quarter panels etc. and act like nothing happened. It really worries me because I  park my car here monthly. My advice, walk around your car every time before you leave.

Update: After almost a year at this garage, I have to say my first initial review was made prematurely. I've given them the benefit of the doubt and so far no issues as of yet after the first incident where my car got damaged. Gratefully, they took full responsibility of the damage and my car was repaired. The manager Luis is a pleasure to talk to and work with. This garage is miles better than any of the other garages I've used. Best of all the location is convenient and within walking distance from my house. The entrance is enormous and the experience/service that the staff has provided me so far for the most part is good.

originalText.text:
The valet experience is so bad. You never know when you will get your car no matter how long you notify them upfront. The garage manager just keep talking BS and blame you on don’t notify them earlier.

I notify them 45 minutes earlier and I still cannot get my car when I am there, and the garage manager suggest me tell them one day earlier???

Btw, their elevator is broken once and I cannot get my car all the night. The way they handle it was that they told me “they were busy” so I need to wait for extra half hour, until I was there and the guy told me all elevator were not functional so they couldn’t get the car. The ironic thing is, the garage manager, on the next day’s phone, told me their elevators were all good, interesting.
